options.A: To store and manipulate data during program execution
options.B: To control the flow of the program's execution
options.C: To display messages or prompts to the user

options.C: A series of instructions that are executed repeatedly
options.D: A graphical user interface for an application

questions.question: What is the difference between a function and a method in programming?

options.A: Functions are built-in to programming languages, while methods are created by programmers
options.B: Functions operate on classes, while methods operate on objects or instances
options.C: Functions are used for mathematical calculations, while methods are used for text processing
options.D: There is no difference, the terms are interchangeable

questions.question: What is a conditional statement in programming?

options.A: A statement that is always executed regardless of any conditions
options.B: A statement that allows the program to make decisions based on different conditions
options.C: A statement that outputs the result of a calculation or comparison
options.D: A statement that is used to document the purpose and functionality of code

options.B: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem
options.D: A keyboard shortcut for executing code

questions.question: What is the purpose of comments in programming?
